meanings.definition: A horse-drawn carriage used for transporting passengers and mail.
meanings.sent1: The stagecoaches rattled along the dusty road, carrying people and letters.
meanings.sent2: In the olden days, stagecoaches were a common mode of transportation.
meanings.sent3: The stagecoach driver waved cheerfully as he passed by, his passengers enjoying the bumpy ride.
meanings.sent4: The stagecoaches were like time machines, taking travelers back to a bygone era.
meanings.sent5: The image of the stagecoach rolling through the wild west is iconic.

meanings.sent1: We decided to stagecoach to the next town for a fun adventure.
meanings.sent2: Back in the day, people would stagecoach across the country for weeks.
meanings.sent3: I stagecoached to the market, feeling like a character in an old western movie.
meanings.sent4: She stagecoaches through life, embracing every new experience with enthusiasm.
meanings.sent5: The idea of stagecoaching through history books excited the young students.
